Package co.decodable.sdk.pipeline

package co.decodable.sdk.pipeline
An SDK for implementing Apache Flink jobs and running them on Decodable.

The SDK provides Source and StatefulSink implementations which integrate Decodable managed streams and, in turn, connections seamlessly with custom Flink jobs. For instance, you can retrieve the elements of a stream, apply a custom mapping function to them, and write them back to another stream using a Flink job like this: 

public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
  StreamExecutionEnvironment env = StreamExecutionEnvironment.getExecutionEnvironment();

  DecodableStreamSource<String> source = DecodableStreamSource.builder()
      .withStreamName("purchase-orders")
      .build();

  DecodableStreamSink<String> sink = DecodableStreamSink.builder()
      .withStreamName("purchase-orders-processed")
      .build();

  DataStream<String> stream = env.fromSource(source, WatermarkStrategy.noWatermarks(), "Purchase Orders Source")
      .map(new PurchaseOrderProcessor());

  stream.sinkTo(sink);

  env.execute("Purchase Order Processor");
}

    Description
    DecodableCommittable
    A committable used with DecodableStreamSink.

    Enumerator state used with DecodableStreamSource.
    DecodableSourceSplit
    A source split used with DecodableStreamSource.
    DecodableStreamSink<T>
    A StatefulSink which allows to write to a Decodable stream from within a Flink job.
    DecodableStreamSinkBuilder
    Builder for creating DecodableStreamSink instances.
    DecodableStreamSource<T>
    A Source which allows to retrieve the contents of a Decodable stream from within a Flink job.
    DecodableStreamSourceBuilder
    Builder for creating DecodableStreamSource instances.
    DecodableWriter<T>
    Sink writer used by DecodableStreamSink.

    Writer state used by DecodableWriter.
    EnvironmentAccess
    Provides access to the environment from within a custom Flink job.
    EnvironmentAccess.Environment
    Exposes the environment variables of the current process.
    StartupMode
    Defines from which offset to consume the underlying stream when starting up a DecodableStreamSource.
